Bailey_Zimmerman:
{{short description|American singer}} {{Use mdy dates|date=February 2024}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Bailey Zimmerman | image = Bailey Zimmerman on YouTube.png | caption = Zimmerman in 2023 | alt = A waist-up view of singer Bailey Zimmerman, holding a bottle in his left hand. | birth_name = Bailey Lynn Zimmerman{{cite web|url=https://www.ascap.com/repertory#/ace/search/workID/912874870 |title=CHANGE |website=ASCAP |publisher=American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers |access-date=July 23, 2023}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|2000|01|27}}[https://www.countrythangdaily.com/bailey-zimmerman-facts/] Country Thang Daily | birth_place = [[Louisville, Illinois]], U.S. | genre = {{flatlist| * [[Country music|Country]] * [[Southern rock]] }} | occupation = {{flatlist| * Singer * songwriter }} | instrument = {{flatlist| *Vocals *guitar }} | years_active = 2020–present | label = {{flatlist| * [[List of Warner Music Group labels#Warner Music Nashville|Warner Nashville]] * [[Elektra Records|Elektra]] }} | website = {{URL|baileyzimmermanofficial.com}} }} '''Bailey Lynn Zimmerman''' (born January 27, 2000) is an American [[Country music|country]] singer. In 2022, he charted the singles "[[Fall in Love (Bailey Zimmerman song)|Fall in Love]]" and "[[Rock and a Hard Place (Bailey Zimmerman song)|Rock and a Hard Place]]", which both reached number one on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Country Airplay]] chart.{{Cite magazine |last=Asker |first=Jim |date=2023-05-01 |title=Bailey Zimmerman's 'Rock' Skips to Historic Sixth Week Atop Country Airplay Chart |url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/bailey-zimmerman-rock-and-a-hard-place-number-one-country-airplay-six-weeks/ |access-date=2024-04-11 |magazine=Billboard |language=en-US}} His debut album ''[[Religiously. The Album.]]'' was released on May 12, 2023. This album also includes the singles "[[Religiously (song)|Religiously]]" and "[[Where It Ends]]". ==Early life== Zimmerman was born in [[Louisville, Illinois]]. He began playing the guitar at the age of nine, devoting much of his childhood to riding dirt bikes and playing baseball.{{Cite web |last=@BCMF_Taylor |date=2024-02-19 |title=Get to Know Your BCMF 2024 Artists: Bailey Zimmerman |url=https://barefootcountrymusicfest.com/get-to-know-your-bcmf-2024-artists-bailey-zimmerman/ |access-date=2024-04-10 |website=Barefoot Country Music Fest |language=en}} His mother first introduced him to various [[hair metal]] bands as well as [[Kid Rock]], [[Avenged Sevenfold]], and [[Nickelback]] when he was a teenager. In 2012, his mother took him to his first concert, which was performed by [[Tesla (band)|Tesla]]. It was the only other concert he had attended before he became a singer. In comparison, his father would take long trips with Zimmerman playing [[country music]] on the radio. Prior to making music, he worked in the [[meat-packing industry]] in 2016. Shortly after graduating, he relocated to West Virginia to work on a union gas [[pipeline]].{{cite web|url=https://www.warnermusicnashville.com/artist/bailey-zimmerman|title=Bailey Zimmerman (Bio)|work=[[Warner Music Group|Warner Music Nashville]]|access-date=June 19, 2022|archive-date=June 19, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220619014605/https://www.warnermusicnashville.com/artist/bailey-zimmerman|url-status=dead}}{{Cite web |title=TikTok - Make Your Day |url=https://www.tiktok.com/@bailey.zimmerman/video/6877684211571117318 |access-date=2024-04-10 |website=www.tiktok.com}} He graduated from [[North Clay High School]] on May 12, 2018.{{Citation |title=2018 North Clay High School Graduation LIVE | date=May 12, 2018 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JYGZrE8cJvQ |access-date=2024-02-21 |language=en}}{{Cite web |title=North Clay High School Alumni |url=https://www.allhighschools.com/school/north-clay-high-school/1000004743 |access-date=February 21, 2024 |website=AllHighSchools}} Due to a lack of time spent with his family, he quit pipelining to pursue a truck lift venture with his stepbrother's welding business Top Notch Metal Worx. He started promoting the business through his [[TikTok]] account to acquire customers.{{Cite AV media |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XGhkd-_nqic |title=How Bailey Zimmerman Accidentally Became A Country Star... |language=en |access-date=2024-05-10 |via=www.youtube.com}} == Career == === Early career (2020–2021) === While awaiting the completion of a customer's build at his stepbrother's establishment, Bailey recorded himself singing "[[Stay (Black Stone Cherry song)|Stay]]" by [[Black Stone Cherry]] for [[Snapchat]]. His motivation was to impress girls. Songwriter Gavin Lucas, whose father had been Bailey's school bus driver in elementary school, came across Bailey's story and was taken aback by his singing ability. Lucas informed Bailey that the video had been widely shared, and he expressed interest in hearing some of Bailey's own songs.{{Cite web |title=Meet Bailey Zimmerman, Country's Biggest New Star Who Still Can't Believe He's Famous {{!}} GRAMMY.com |url=https://grammy.com/news/bailey-zimmerman-new-album-religiously-rock-and-a-hard-place-fall-in-love-tiktok-songs-never-comin-home-morgan-wallen-tour-opener-debut |access-date=2024-04-10 |website=grammy.com}} Several weeks later, while at his uncle's body shop, Lucas approached Bailey with a request to collaborate on a song. In response, Bailey penned the first verse of "Never Comin' Home." Subsequently, they captured a video of Bailey performing the song with Lucas accompanying on guitar.{{Cite magazine |last=Freeman |first=Jon |date=2023-03-17 |title=Bailey Zimmerman Was Working a Gas Pipeline and Making Truck TikToks. Now He's Touring With Morgan Wallen |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/bailey-zimmerman-religiously-album-morgan-wallen-tour-1234698608/ |access-date=2024-04-10 |magazine=Rolling Stone |language=en-US}} In December 2020, Zimmerman started sharing original music on his TikTok account, notably featuring "Never Comin' Home." Within a mere five hours, a snippet of the song had garnered over a million views. Motivated by this rapid success, he secured a studio in [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]] to professionally record the track, investing $3,000. He made the decision to resign from his job shortly after. With finances tight, he turned to his mother, requesting $1,500. He conveyed to her the escalating traction of his song and his aspirations to pursue a career as a Country singer. On February 3, 2021, he released his debut single "Never Comin' Home", which later entered the top 20 on [[Spotify]]'s Viral Chart in the United States.{{cite web|url=https://charts.spotify.com/charts/view/viral-us-daily/2021-03-15/|title=Daily Viral Songs USA: March 15, 2021|work=[[Spotify]]|access-date=June 19, 2022}} The co-manager at 10th Street Entertainment Scott Frazier came across Zimmerman on TikTok and subsequently introduced him to Core Entertainment principals Kevin Zaruk and Simon Tikhman.{{Cite web |title=ZIMMERMAN UNBOUND |url=https://hitsdailydouble.com/music_city&id=327870&title=ZIMMERMAN-UNBOUND |access-date=2024-03-05 |website=HITS Daily Double |language=en}} He later signed to Core Entertainment in August 2021.{{Cite web |last=Hollabaugh |first=Lorie |date=2021-08-19 |title=Bailey Zimmerman Signs With The Core Entertainment, 10th Street Entertainment |url=https://musicrow.com/2021/08/bailey-zimmerman-signs-with-the-core-entertainment-10th-street-entertainment/ |access-date=2024-03-05 |website=MusicRow.com |language=en-US}} The same month, he performed his first show at "Rock The South 2021" with a backing band he only met three days prior to the performance.{{Cite web |last=Reynolds |first=Scott |date=2021-09-18 |title=Louisville artist manager helping musicians achieve dreams |url=https://www.wdrb.com/news/louisville-artist-manager-helping-musicians-achieve-dreams/article_f42d322e-18e5-11ec-bd4d-4f0574d5a041.html |access-date=2024-03-05 |website=WDRB |language=en}} === Mainstream success (2022–present) === His breakout single "[[Fall in Love (Bailey Zimmerman song)|Fall in Love]]" was released on February 11, 2022, and reached number 29 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] in October.{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/hot-100/|title=Billboard Hot 100|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}} This was followed by additional singles "[[Rock and a Hard Place (Bailey Zimmerman song)|Rock and a Hard Place]]" and "Where It Ends" in June and August 2022, respectively. Due to the success of these songs, Zimmerman was signed to [[List of Warner Music Group labels#Warner Music Nashville|Warner Music Nashville]] and [[Elektra Records]],{{cite web | url=https://musicrow.com/2022/04/bailey-zimmerman-joins-warner-music-nashville-elektra-music-group-roster/ | title=Bailey Zimmerman Joins Warner Music Nashville, Elektra Music Group Roster | publisher=[[MusicRow]] | date=April 13, 2022 | accessdate=June 20, 2022}} with "Fall in Love" later charting at Country radio format.{{cite web | url=https://tasteofcountry.com/bailey-zimmerman-rock-and-a-hard-place/ | title=Hear Bailey Zimmerman's Brooding New 'Rock and a Hard Place' | publisher=[[Taste of Country]] | date=June 14, 2022 | accessdate=June 20, 2022}}{{cite web | url=https://musicrow.com/2022/06/disclaimer-single-reviews-toby-keith-shows-off-his-mighty-vocals-on-oklahoma-breakdown/ | title=DISClaimer Single Reviews: Toby Keith Shows Off His Mighty Vocals On 'Oklahoma Breakdown' | publisher=MusicRow | date=June 16, 2022 | accessdate=June 20, 2022}} Zimmerman released his debut major-label project ''[[Leave the Light On (EP)|Leave the Light On]]'' on October 14, 2022. It debuted in the top ten of the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and [[Canadian Albums]] charts.{{cite web|url=https://etcanada.com/news/938822/bailey-zimmerman-shatters-country-records-with-debut-album/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221024230750/https://etcanada.com/news/938822/bailey-zimmerman-shatters-country-records-with-debut-album/|url-status=dead|archive-date=October 24, 2022|title=Bailey Zimmerman Shatters Country Records With Debut Album|date=October 24, 2022|first=Melissa|last=Romualdi|work=[[Entertainment Tonight Canada|ET Canada]]|access-date=November 2, 2022}} As a result of high demand, Zimmerman extended his headlining tour of the United States into the fall of 2022, with [[Josh Ross]] opening his early 2023 dates.{{cite web|url=https://musicmayhemmagazine.com/bailey-zimmerman-breaks-streaming-records-leave-the-light-on-becomes-the-biggest-streaming-country-debut-of-all-time/|title=Bailey Zimmerman Breaks Streaming Records & 'Leave The Light On' Becomes The Biggest Streaming Country Debut Of All Time|first=Ally|last=Roden|work=Music Mayhem Magazine|date=October 31, 2022}} He made his [[Grand Ole Opry]] debut on November 4, 2022.{{Cite web |title=BAILEY'S GRAND OLE DEBUT |url=https://hitsdailydouble.com/music_city&id=333630&title=BAILEY%E2%80%99S-GRAND-OLE-DEBUT |access-date=2024-03-05 |website=HITS Daily Double |language=en}} [[Morgan Wallen]] announced that Zimmerman would be one of the opening acts for his One Night at a Time World Tour in 2023.{{Cite web |date=2022-12-02 |title=MORGAN WALLEN ANNOUNCES 2023 ONE NIGHT AT A TIME WORLD TOUR - Side Stage Magazine |url=https://sidestagemagazine.com/morgan-wallen-announces-2023-one-night-at-a-time-world-tour/ |access-date=2024-03-05 |website=sidestagemagazine.com |language=en-US}} On March 17, 2023, Zimmerman announced his debut album ''[[Religiously. The Album.]]'', and it was released on May 12, 2023.{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/bailey-zimmerman-religiously-album-morgan-wallen-tour-1234698608/|title=Bailey Zimmerman Was Working a Gas Pipeline and Making Truck TikToks. Now He's Touring With Morgan Wallen|first=Joe|last=Freeman|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=March 17, 2023|access-date=March 17, 2023}} He will support the album with the "Religiously: The Tour" across the United States, Great Britain, and Ireland in 2024, with [[Josh Ross]] again joining him as an opening act.{{cite web|url=https://countrychord.com/bailey-zimmerman-announces-the-religiously-2024-tour/|title=Bailey Zimmerman Announces The "Religiously" 2024 Tour W/ Josh Ross|first=Clayton|last=Anderson|work=Country Chord|date=June 12, 2023|access-date=July 3, 2023}} “Rock And A Hard Place” broke the record for the longest climb to the top 10 for a song by a soloist in ''Billboard'' Hot 100 history.{{Cite web |last=Black |first=Lauren Jo |date=2023-04-11 |title=Bailey Zimmerman Smashes Chart Records With Second No.1, 'Rock And A Hard Place' |url=https://countrynow.com/bailey-zimmerman-smashes-chart-records-with-second-no-1-rock-and-a-hard-place/ |access-date=2024-03-05 |website=Country Now |language=en-US}} On February 23, 2024, Zimmerman released "[[Holy Smokes (Bailey Zimmerman song)|Holy Smokes]]" as the lead single for his second album which was previously teased through TikTok.{{Cite web |last=White |first=Logan |date=2024-02-23 |title=Bailey Zimmerman shares new song "Holy Smokes" |url=https://substreammagazine.com/2024/02/bailey-zimmerman-shares-new-song-holy-smokes/ |access-date=2024-04-10 |website=Substream Magazine |language=en-US}} It debuted at No. 54. Zimmerman would be featured on the soundtrack for 2024 film ''[[Twisters (film)|''Twisters''"]] with his song "Hell or High Water."{{Cite web |date=2024-05-24 |title=Bailey Zimmerman has his new song "Hell or High Water" in Twisters: The Album |url=https://www.rfdtv.com/bailey-zimmerman-has-his-new-song-hell-or-high-water-in-twisters-the-album |access-date=2024-06-18 |website=RFD-TV |language=en}} On June 17, 2024, Zimmerman created anticipation for his new track "New To Country" by teasing it on social media platforms, following its use as pre-concert hype music.{{Cite web |title=Bailey Zimmerman Offers Playful Response to Critics with Unreleased Song, 'New To Country' {{!}} Holler |url=https://holler.country/news/breaking/bailey-zimmerman-offers-playful-response-to-critics-with-unreleased-song-new-to-country |access-date=2024-06-18 |website=holler.country |language=en}} == Artistry == Zimmerman is noted for having a raspy, gritty voice with influences stemming from [[Nickelback]], Tesla, and [[Eric Church]].{{Cite web |last=Caramanica |first=Jon |date=2023-05-11 |title=How Bailey Zimmerman Charmed Nashville |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2023/05/11/arts/music/bailey-zimmerman-religiously-the-album.html |website=New York Times |id={{ProQuest|2811839088}}}} His sound is a mix of [[Rock music|rock]] and country.{{Cite web |date=2022-07-28 |title=7 Facts To Get To Know Bailey Zimmerman |url=https://warnermusic.co.nz/news/7-facts-to-get-to-know-bailey-zimmerman |access-date=2024-04-10 |website=[[Warner Music New Zealand]]}} == Personal life == Zimmerman is a Christian.{{Cite web |last=Chua |first=Jeremy |title=Faith inspires Bailey Zimmerman's new tattoo |url=https://southernillinoisnow.com/2023/07/31/faith-inspires-bailey-zimmermans-new-tattoo/ |access-date=2024-07-12 |website=South Central Illinois' News, Sports and Weather Station |language=en}} His parents divorced at the age of ten.{{Cite web |date=2023-10-12 |title=How Bailey Zimmerman's breakup songs made him country's breakout star |url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/music/story/2023-10-12/bailey-zimmerman-religiously-rock-and-a-hard-place |access-date=2024-04-10 |website=Los Angeles Times |language=en-US}} He has an older brother Dalton, and younger brother Nicholas.{{Cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/CuxlKrJoORd/?hl=en|title=Instagram|website=www.instagram.com}} On February 11, 2023, Bailey performed at BetMGM’s West [[Super Bowl]] Fest held at the [[Westgate Entertainment District]] in [[Glendale, Arizona]]. However, during his performance of "Rock And A Hard Place," technical difficulties resulted in Bailey losing audio feedback, leading to an unintentional off-key performance. This incident garnered significant attention, with a TikTok video capturing the moment amassing over eleven million views.{{Cite web |title=TikTok - Make Your Day |url=https://www.tiktok.com/@tomatobisque22/video/7199149763294645550?lang=en |access-date=2024-05-10 |website=www.tiktok.com}} Consequently, Bailey faced accusations of being unable to sing. Responding to the ensuing backlash on February 15, Zimmerman, acknowledged the incident and issued a public apology.{{Cite web |last=MUSIC· |first=Brady Cox·COUNTRY |date=2023-02-13 |title=Bailey Zimmerman Responds To Viral Super Bowl Weekend Performance: "Ears Went Out… I Swear I'm Not THAT Bad" |url=https://www.whiskeyriff.com/2023/02/13/bailey-zimmerman-responds-to-viral-super-bowl-weekend-performance-ears-went-out-i-swear-im-not-that-bad/ |access-date=2024-05-10 |website=Whiskey Riff |language=en-US}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Details ! scope="col" colspan="4"| Peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| [[Music recording sales certification|Certifications]] |- ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:85%;"| [[Billboard 200|US]]
